baseline_groups.claim_summary: Forecast revisions positively predict forecast errors (beta > 0), indicating forecasters under-react to news consistent with rational inattention (Coibion-Gorodnichenko regression).
baseline_groups.notes: Single baseline specification: bivariate OLS of log forecast error on forecast revision using SPF GDP data (157 obs after 99th percentile outlier removal). Beta = 0.757, SE = 0.299, p = 0.012.

global_notes: This paper has a single core empirical claim tested via the CG regression. The specification search produced 70 specifications total. Several rows duplicate earlier rows (early_period = subsample1_early; late_period = subsample2_late). Some alternative outcome specifications (absolute, squared, sign, large_error) change the estimand substantially and are classified as non-core. Heterogeneity interaction terms test moderation rather than the main claim and are classified as non-core. Placebo tests are correctly identified. Growth rate functional form reverses sign. First differences and GLS AR(1) reverse sign.
